\section{Introduction}
\label{\detokenize{index:introduction}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This is the documentation for my second class assignment \sphinxstylestrong{2R Analysing Multimodal Language Data for Quantitative Social Science}.
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{custom\_packages.misc\_modules.config}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{custom\_packages.misc\_modules.styling\_and\_animations}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{custom\_packages.misc\_modules.visualisations}

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The code provided here is designed to:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Preprocess} the CSV data relating to extracted acoustic features and speaker demographics.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Classify} speech based on its intent (trustworthy vs. neutral).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Validate} the dataset’s effectiveness in categorising speech according to speaker intent and demographics.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Visualise} the relationship between speaker demographics, acoustic features and trustworthy intent classifications.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For detailed instructions on how to set up the environment, run the analysis scripts, and interpret the results,
refer to the \sphinxstylestrong{Getting Started} section.

The default is 4.0.

\item {}

\paragraph{custom\_packages.misc\_modules.visualisations.plot\_word\_frequencies}
\label{\detokenize{_autosummary/custom_packages.misc_modules.visualisations.plot_word_frequencies:custom-packages-misc-modules-visualisations-plot-word-frequencies}}\label{\detokenize{_autosummary/custom_packages.misc_modules.visualisations.plot_word_frequencies::doc}}\index{plot\_word\_frequencies() (in module custom\_packages.misc\_modules.visualisations)@\spxentry{plot\_word\_frequencies()}\spxextra{in module custom\_packages.misc\_modules.visualisations}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{_autosummary/custom_packages.misc_modules.visualisations.plot_word_frequencies:custom_packages.misc_modules.visualisations.plot_word_frequencies}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{plot\_word\_frequencies}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{df}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{words\_num}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Shows a bar plot with the most frequent words across all transcripts.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{df}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pd.DataFrame}}) – A document\sphinxhyphen{}ffeature matrix (DFM) with keyword frequencies.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{process\_audio\_stream}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{video\_url}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
1. Downloading the best audio stream, starting from m4a if available, as its small size
is convinient for my local resources.
2. Converting that audio stream to a mono 16kHz mp4 audio file.
3. Storing that audio file as a temporary resource.

\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar
The path directory of the temporarily stored mp4 audio file.
If failed, returns empty string.

\sphinxstyleemphasis{str}

the whisper\sphinxhyphen{}1 model, and stores them as a concatenated string as a .txt file in the given filepath with
the video id argument as part of the transcript name.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{video\_id}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{audio\_dir}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Path}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{transcript\_dir}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}})

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleemphasis{str}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Retrieves the partly cleaned/preprocessed text (decoupling contranctions, converting to lowercase and removing}
\sphinxAtStartPar
dashes and unnecessary white spaces already done earlier) from the dataframe argument.

\end{description}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Finishes preprocessing by removing punctuation, stopwords, and applies tokenisation through NLTK.

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Does sentiment analysis using NLTK Vader SentimentIntensityAnalyzer on the tokenised text, and calculates the}
\sphinxAtStartPar
polarity scores (positive, negative, neutral).

\end{description}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Visualises the sentiment and translated trust labels in a plot each.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns a dataframe with the scores and labels.

\end{enumerate}

\subsubsection{custom\_packages.modelling\_modules.nlp\_modelling.get\_dominant\_topic}
\label{\detokenize{_autosummary/custom_packages.modelling_modules.nlp_modelling.get_dominant_topic:custom-packages-modelling-modules-nlp-modelling-get-dominant-topic}}\label{\detokenize{_autosummary/custom_packages.modelling_modules.nlp_modelling.get_dominant_topic::doc}}\index{get\_dominant\_topic() (in module custom\_packages.modelling\_modules.nlp\_modelling)@\spxentry{get\_dominant\_topic()}\spxextra{in module custom\_packages.modelling\_modules.nlp\_modelling}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{_autosummary/custom_packages.modelling_modules.nlp_modelling.get_dominant_topic:custom_packages.modelling_modules.nlp_modelling.get_dominant_topic}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_dominant\_topic}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{df}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Does topic modelling using FASTopic on the cleaned text from each transcript and retrieves teh top keywords
identified per topic (5 most popular topics in this instance).
Displays a plot per sentiment model for a trust\sphinxhyphen{}sentiment score by topic assessment.
It also displays another plot that clusters transcripts with similar topics.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
